page.title: 01Upper Tasburgh Norfolk
page.content: The A140 bisects th grid square from North to south. In the south west is Upper Tasburgh, including a hill fort on which is the church with a saxon tower. Between it and the A140 are housing estates. 1. south houses of various sizes, inhabitants of different ages. Built C1970. 2. N The road is edged with council houses, behind is an estate of 84 houses mostly 1st ho,es of people who work in Norwich and an infants school. Nearby is a small green beside it and the A140 are some older houses, including a farm and pub. In the south of the grid the River Tas flows east-wes through a valley with water meadows grazed by sheep and cattle, the Hempnall east of the A140 is sparsely inhabited farmland with some woodland and scatterd farms. In the south is the site of Boyland Hall
